intro: Kadua elatior, commonly known as the showy kadua, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange, often with a contrasting throat. Kadua elatior typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
